section.section: The Commission consists of 12 members appointed by the Governor.
The number of names on a list shall be at least 3.
An organization shall submit its list at least 3 months before the expiration of the term of the member who represents the organization.

If a list is not submitted to the Governor as required under subparagraph (iii) of this paragraph or if a vacancy occurs for a reason other than expiration of the term, the Governor may appoint any individual without the list.
The term of a member is 4 years.
The terms of the members are staggered as required by the terms provided for members of the Commission on July 1, 1982. The terms of one fourth of those members end each year.
At the end of a term, a member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who serves 2 consecutive full 4-year terms may not be reappointed for 4 years after completion of those terms.
If a vacancy occurs, the Governor promptly shall appoint a successor who will serve until the term expires.
The successor may be reappointed for a full term.
